value_labels:
1 - automated
2- manual
3 - OBN (no CII record on file)
4 - Hybrid (began 1993)

description: statewide unique identification number for an individual
question_text:
Enter the unique state identification number, referred to as the “CII#”, assigned to the subject’s criminal
history record. If no CII number is available or known to the agency, leave the area blank and continue
processing the form.

value_labels:
00 - new offender (no arrest before 8/23/82)
01 - current offender (arrested before 8/23/82)
02 - unknown
09 - delete CII

question_text: Enter the complete name of the subject as it was submitted on the arrest fingerprint submission or as indicated on the citation. Aliases, nicknames, or monikers are not required.

description: day of the month the individual was born
question_text: Enter the month/day/year (MM/DD/YYYY) of the subject’s birth.
Enter the month/day/year (MM/DD/YYYY) of the subject’s birth.
Enter the month/day/year (MM/DD/YYYY) of the subject’s birth.

Enter the appropriate sex code abbreviation for the subject.
M = Male
F = Female
X = Unknown
value_labels:
M - Male
F - Female
X - Unknown

question_text: Enter the appropriate race code abbreviation for the subject. The criteria for determining race categories are in the TABLES Section.
value_labels: SEE race_or_ethnicity.csv
notes: The codes for Asian/Pacific Islander became more detailed in 1991. San Francisco did not change its reporting practices until 2012, when it adopted the FBI's categories for race: white, black, American Indian, other Asian, and other. Since 2012, San Francisco has not distinguished between non-Hispanic whites and Hispanic whites.

value_labels:
0 - not deceased or no information
1 - deceased
2 - deceased (homicide)

question_text: Enter the month/day/year (MM-DD-YYYY) of: 1) the subject’s arrest as it was submitted on the arrest fingerprint submission, 2) the date the complaint was sought or filed, or 3) the date of citation.
notes: EG: MAYBE WE JUST PROVIDE YEAR HERE, BUT INTERNALLY USE THE FULL DATE AS DAY 0 IN THE PROCESS

question_text: Enter the complete name of the agency that arrested, cited, or requested a complaint be filed against the subject. Abbreviates for Type of Agency are acceptable; however, the county or city name should be spelled out followed by SO, PD, etc.
value_labels:
abbreviations for agency type:
PD Police Department
SO Sheriff’s Office (Department)
CHP California Highway Patrol
MR Marshal
INS United States Immigration and Naturalization Service
FBI Federal Bureau of Investigation
DA District Attorney
CA City Attorney
NTF Narcotic Task Force
notes: may actually be booking and not arresting agency
